cn.edu.uestc.acmicpc.web.xml

Class XmlNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • cn.edu.uestc.acmicpc.web.xml.XmlNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<XmlNode>

    public class XmlNode
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<XmlNode>
    Basic node object used by xml parser.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      XmlNode()
      Construct a xml node and initialize the child nodes list and attribute list.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addAttribute(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String value)
      Add new attribute into the attribute list, if the attribute list is null or there is same attribute in the list, throw AppException.
      void addChild(XmlNode child)
      Add a new child node into the child nodes list, if the child node or child nodes list is null, or this is same node in the child node list, throw AppException.
      java.lang.String getAttribute(java.lang.String key)
      Get specified attribute innerText from the attribute list, if the attribute list is null or there is no such attribute in the attribute list, return empty string, otherwise return the innerText of this attribute.
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getAttributes() 
      java.util.List<XmlNode> getChildList() 
      java.lang.String getInnerText() 
      java.lang.String getTagName()

      Get the iterator of parameters.
      void removeAttribute(java.lang.String key)
      Remove specified attribute from the attribute list, if the attribute is null or there is such attribute in the list, throw AppException.

      • addAttribute

        public void addAttribute(java.lang.String key,

                  throws AppException

        Parameters:
        key - the name of the attribute we want to add
        value - attribute innerText
        Throws:
        AppException

      • getAttribute

        public java.lang.String getAttribute(java.lang.String key)
                              throws AppException
        Get specified attribute innerText from the attribute list, if the attribute list is null or there is no such attribute in the attribute list, return empty string, otherwise return the innerText of this attribute.
        Parameters:
        key - the attribute name
        Returns:
        the innerText of the attribute
        Throws:
        AppException
